entry.title: bitcoin.org missing bitcoin core version 22.0
entry.summary:
In the realm of Bitcoin development and maintenance, a significant emphasis has been placed on the importance of decentralization and the roles individuals play in sustaining this ethos. The discussion opens with reflections on the expectations from maintainers of Bitcoin, emphasizing respect for the Founder of Bitcoin and the necessity to preserve important documents and counter any attempts by affluent scammers to alter foundational elements. This conversation is anchored around a specific pull request ([PR #740](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoincore.org/pull/740)), which has become a historical reference point showcasing the challenges and dynamics within the Bitcoin community.
The aftermath of the mentioned PR underscores a broader movement towards true decentralization, highlighted by the distribution of the whitepaper across various platforms. This scenario propels the argument for the need to embrace and expand decentralization within Bitcoin's full node implementations. Currently, an overwhelming majority of nodes operate on Bitcoin Core, indicative of a centralization tendency that contradicts the decentralized ethos Bitcoin aims to embody. Suggestions for enhancing decentralization include encouraging the use of alternative full node implementations, advocating for contributions from diverse individuals including those who are uncompromisingly dedicated to the project's principles, increasing global participation, and welcoming anonymous contributors. Additionally, there's a call to individuals and organizations funding Bitcoin projects to consider supporting alternatives like Bitcoin Knots.
The dialogue further delves into the philosophy of acknowledging issues within the Bitcoin ecosystem and actively seeking solutions. This approach is deemed as the most constructive way forward for engineers and contributors in the space. Highlighting the toxicity of both irrational optimism and pessimism, the conversation presents a balanced viewpoint on navigating challenges within Bitcoin's development landscape. Reference is made to a Medium post ([OP Halloween21 and Bitcoin Knots](https://prayankgahlot.medium.com/op-halloween21-and-bitcoin-knots-b8a4da4fa0bd)) that elaborates on these themes, reinforcing the message of proactive problem-solving and improvement.
Additionally, the imminent activation of Taproot, marking another successful soft fork, is celebrated as evidence of ongoing progress and enhancement within the Bitcoin protocol. This milestone is acknowledged with gratitude towards everyone who contributed to this achievement, signaling optimism for widespread adoption of the latest versions of Bitcoin Core or other full node implementations. This narrative not only captures the technical aspects of Bitcoin's evolution but also the community and philosophical shifts driving its continued development.
